policytree 0.9.2

Predict method for policy_tree

Source: R/policy_tree.R
predict.policy_tree.Rd

Predict values based on fitted policy_tree object.

# S3 method for policy_tree
predict(object, newdata, ...)

Arguments

object

policy_tree object
newdata

A data frame with features
...

Additional arguments (currently ignored).

Value

A vector of predictions. Each element is an integer from 1 to d where d is the number of columns in the reward matrix.

Examples

# \donttest{
n <- 50
p <- 10
d <- 3
features <- matrix(rnorm(n * p), n, p)
rewards <- matrix(rnorm(n * d), n, d)
tree <- policy_tree(features, rewards, depth = 2)
print(tree)
#> policy_tree object 
#> Tree depth:  2 
#> Actions:  1 2 3 
#> Variable splits: 
#> (1) split_variable: X8  split_value: -0.497787 
#>   (2) split_variable: X9  split_value: -0.0779415 
#>     (4) * action: 2 
#>     (5) * action: 1 
#>   (3) split_variable: X2  split_value: -0.941508 
#>     (6) * action: 3 
#>     (7) * action: 1 
predict(tree, features)
#>  [1] 1 2 1 1 1 1 1 2 1 1 3 1 1 1 1 1 1 2 3 1 1 2 1 1 2 1 1 1 2 1 1 1 1 1 1 2 1 1
#> [39] 1 2 1 1 2 1 2 1 1 3 3 1
# }
